Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: ASSEMBLY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a well drilling assembly. An assemblymay be valid for part of a period, or one or more full periods.
Column Comment.2: COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier that represents an instance of acomponent on the well drilling assembly. If componments are added or removed, anew assembly record in WELL DRILL ASSEMBLY should be created to track thechange.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.5: COMPONENT COUNT: the number of individual components of the same type,represented by this row of data, that are installed on the assembly. If each individualcomponent is tracked seperately with a new row on this table, this number should be1. If groups of components are tracked in this row of data, the number should equalthe total number of individual components represented by this row.
Column Comment.6: COMPONENT DESCRIPTION: A short textual description of the component.
Column Comment.7: COMPONENT LENGTH: The length of an individual component, or the combinedlength of a group of components, depending on the type of component being tracked.
Column Comment.8: COMPONENT LENGTH ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE
Column Comment.9: COMPONENT SEQUENCE NUMBER: A number identifying the sequence in whichcomponents are installed on the assembly. If a row of data represents a group ofcomponents, use this columnn to indicate the overall positioning of the instance onthe assembly.
Column Comment.10: DRILL ASSEMBLY COMPONENT TYPE: A reference table describing the type ofcomponent that has been placed on the assembly. Specific equipment parameters,manufacturer information etc may be captured by using the EQUIPMENT module.
Column Comment.11: COMPONENT WEIGHT: the weight of the individual component or group ofcomponents, depending on how the data is being stored.
Column Comment.12: COMPONENT WEIGHT ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.15: MAXIMUM INSIDE DIAMETER: Maximum inside diameter measured for thiscomponent or group of components.
Column Comment.17: MAXIMUM OUTSIDE DIAMETER: the maximum outside diameter for this componentor group of components in an assembly.
Column Comment.18: MAXIMUM OUTSIDE DIAMETER ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE
Column Comment.19: MINIMUM INSIDE DIAMETER: Minimum inside diameter measured for thiscomponent or group of components.
Column Comment.21: MINIMUM OUTSIDE DIAMETER: the minimum outside diameter for this componentor group of components in an assembly.
Column Comment.22: MINIMUM OUTSIDE DIAMETER ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.25: SERIAL NUMBER: If you wish, the serial number for an individual component may becaptured here.
Column Comment.26: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
